line_1: SO, when the Prince of Rivers, fruitful Nile,
line_2: Has flow'd, and fatten'd all the Memphian Soil,

line_1: Equally fatal, whether on the Nile,
line_2: Or in the city, weeps the crocodile.

line_1: With all the monstrous progeny of Nile.
line_2: While others wore a painted crocodile,

line_1: And rustick pleasures chear the banks of Nile.
line_2: Unbounded crops reward the reaper's toil,

line_1: And let the secret Head of Nile
line_2: Be ever banish'd from your Isle.

line_2: — So from his shell on Delta's shower-less isle

line_1: Immortal ISIS clothed the banks of Nile;
line_2: Taught by her labours, from the fertile soil

line_1: PAPYRA, throned upon the banks of Nile,
line_2: Spread her smooth leaf, and waved her silver style.

line_1: And trusts the scaly monsters of the Nile. —
line_2: Waits on the reed-crown'd brink with pious guile,

line_1: As half-form'd Infects on the Banks of Nile;
line_2: Those half-learn'd Witlings, num'rous in our Isle,

line_1: To those enormous Terrors of the Nile,
line_2: The crested Snake, and long-tail'd Crocodile,

line_1: Shall, on Euphrates' Bank, renew the Grief of Nile.

line_1: Is render'd fertile by th' o'erflowing Nile,
line_2: Why should I mention those, whose ouzy soil

line_1: Nor Tagus envy we, nor fruitful Nile,
line_2: Whose fatt'ning Floods enrich the thirsty Soil:
